import React, { Component } from "react"; import './secondpage.css'; import Poster from './poster.js' import PosterSample from './postersamples.js' import exportedposters from './App.js' import doggo from './img/doggo.jpg'; // import {Rectangle, Circle, Ellipse, Line, Polyline, CornerBox, Triangle} from 'react-shapes'; const ii1 = require('./img/sample1.png') const ii2 = require('./img/sample2.png') const ii3 = require('./img/sample3.png') const ii4 = require('./img/sample4.png') const ii5 = require('./img/sample5.png') const ii6 = require('./img/sample6.png') const ii7 = require('./img/sample7.png') const ii8 = require('./img/sample8.png') const ii9 = require('./img/sample9.png') const ii10 = require('./img/sample10.png') // secondpage will read in the posters, the currently selected one needs to be // read by the poster component and passed to the parent\\ // listdata from child is the information gotten from the child class SecondPage extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { parray: [], clickedposter: ii2, listDataFromChild: null } this.handleSelection = this.handleSelection.bind(this) } // sets up the posters that are displayed componentDidMount() { this.setState(prevState => ({ parray: [...prevState.parray, ii1, ii2, ii3, ii4, ii5, ii6, ii7, ii8, ii9, ii10] })) } // once you click a poster, this function handles the selection, setting the clicked poster image to the one that was clicked handleSelection() { this.setState({ clickedposter: ii1 }); } render() { return (
Simple
Disorder
Sharp
Bright
Dark
Soft
In order
Complex
); } } export default SecondPage;
